items.title: Are Americans Worried About Crime? It Depends on How They Voted.
items.description: The sitting president can be a better predictor of how safe someone feels than what the crime data shows.

items.title: There Was No Way to Know How Many People Died in Missouri Prisons — Until Now
items.description: For years, the state’s Department of Corrections cobbled together death records from multiple sources. New data reveals annual totals for the first ti...

items.title: How We Got Comprehensive Death Data From the Missouri DOC
items.description: After repeated questions about missing deaths in the state’s existing logs, the department shared annual counts for the first time.

items.title: Why No One Knows How Many People Die in Mississippi’s Local Jails
items.description: From medical neglect to suicide, the lack of information on jail deaths can allow the same deadly problems to lead to more deaths.

items.title: ICE Raids Kept On During the Shutdown, But the Detention Data Stayed Hidden
items.description: More than seven weeks have passed since the last comprehensive release of detention and deportation numbers.
